intro: Mesembryanthemum velutinum, commonly known as the velvet mesemb, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its diverse and often ornamental species. The plant features fleshy, hairy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in spring and early summer. It is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and aesthetic appeal.
